00013 // Prototypes
00014 void *receivemaster_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00015 void receivemaster_free(t_jcom_receivemaster *x);
00016 void receivemaster_dispatch(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00017 void receivemaster_add(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj);
00018 void receivemaster_remove(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj);

00020 
00021 // Globals
00022 static t_class          *s_receivemaster_class = NULL;  
00023 static t_hashtab        *s_receive_lists = NULL;                
00024 
00025 
00026 /************************************************************************************/
00027 
00028 void receivemaster_initclass()
00029 {
00030         // Define our class
00031         s_receivemaster_class = class_new(      "jcom.receivemaster", 
00032                                                                                 (method)receivemaster_new, 
00033                                                                                 (method)receivemaster_free, 
00034                                                                                 (short)sizeof(t_jcom_receivemaster), 
00035                                                                                 (method)0L, 
00036                                                                                 A_GIMME, 
00037                                                                                 0);
00038         class_obexoffset_set(s_receivemaster_class, calcoffset(t_jcom_receivemaster, obex));
00039 
00040         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00041         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_dispatch,  "dispatch",     A_CANT, 0L);
00042         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_add,               "add",          A_CANT, 0L);
00043         class_addmethod(s_receivemaster_class, (method)receivemaster_remove,    "remove",       A_CANT, 0L);
00044 
00045         // Finalize our class
00046         class_register(CLASS_NOBOX, s_receivemaster_class);
00047 }
00048 
00049 /************************************************************************************/
00050 // Object Life
00051 
00052 void *receivemaster_new(t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00053 {
00054         t_jcom_receivemaster *x = (t_jcom_receivemaster *)object_alloc(s_receivemaster_class);
00055 
00056         if(!s_receive_lists)
00057                 s_receive_lists = hashtab_new(0);
00058         return x;
00059 }
00060 
00061 void receivemaster_free(t_jcom_receivemaster *x)
00062 {
00063         ;       // we could delete the hashtab, but this class is never deleted so it doesn't really make a difference
00064                 // does it?
00065 }
00066 
00067 
00068 /************************************************************************************/
00069 // Methods
00070 
00071 void receivemaster_dispatch(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00072 {
00073         t_linklist      *list = NULL;                                                                           // linklist of receives with this name
00074 
00075         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00076         if(list)
00077                 linklist_methodall(list, ps_dispatch, msg, argc, argv);         // 2. Call method on every object in the linklist
00078 }
00079 
00080 void receivemaster_add(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj)
00081 {
00082         t_linklist      *list = NULL;
00083 post("ADD: hastbab - %x", s_receive_lists);
00084         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00085         if(!list){
00086                 list = (t_linklist *)linklist_new();                                            // if there isn't a linklist for this name yet,
00087                 hashtab_store(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object *)list);         //      then we make one and store it in the hashtab
00088         }
00089         linklist_append(list, obj);                                                                             // 2. We add the object to the appropriate linklist
00090 }
00091 
00092 
00093 // TODO: When we switch to Max5 then remove these function definitions
00094 #if 1
00095 long linklist_match(void *a, void *b)
00096 {
00097         return a == b;
00098 }
00099 
00100 void linklist_chuckobject(t_linklist *x, void *o)
00101 {
00102         void *obj;
00103         
00104         long index = linklist_findfirst(x, &obj, linklist_match, o);
00105         if(index != -1)
00106                 linklist_chuckindex(x, index);
00107 }
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 
00111 void receivemaster_remove(t_jcom_receivemaster *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *obj)
00112 {
00113         t_linklist      *list = NULL;
00114 
00115         hashtab_lookup(s_receive_lists, name, (t_object **)&list);              // 1. Look up the correct linklist in the hashtab
00116         linklist_chuckobject(list, obj);
00117         if(!linklist_getsize(list))
00118                 hashtab_chuckkey(s_receive_lists, name);                                        // 2. Chuck the key if there are no more objects with this name
00119 }
